page.title: 17RECREATION (East Block)
page.content: {Hartsholme lake}was constructed in 1840 by the{Lincoln Waterworks Company to supply the city with water. A hall was built in 1862 and demolished in 1951.There is just a wall of the old house left.The stable block now houses the information centre, a cafe and facilities for showing slides and films about nature in the park. Hartsholme is now a very beautiful public{country park}covering about 88 acres. It has many attractions such as {boating, fishing and bird watching. There are many amenities for children as well,including an{adventure {playground and a tree trail.}If you would like to stay overnight there is a pleasant{camping site}with good amenities. Charges for one caravan per night would be Â£1.70 and for a small tent it is Â£0.90.
